00022 #include <dfsch/promise.h>
00023 #include "util.h"
00024 
00025 typedef struct promise_t {
00026   dfsch_type_t *type;
00027   dfsch_object_t* expr;
00028   dfsch_object_t* env;
00029   dfsch_object_t* value;
00030   pthread_mutex_t* mutex;
00031   int set;
00032 } promise_t;
00033 
00034 static const dfsch_type_t promise_type = {
00035   DFSCH_STANDARD_TYPE,
00036   NULL,
00037   sizeof(promise_t),
00038   "promise",
00039   NULL,
00040   NULL
00041 };
00042 
00043 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_make_promise(dfsch_object_t* expr, dfsch_object_t* env){
00044   promise_t* p = (promise_t*)dfsch_make_object(&promise_type);
00045 
00046   p->expr = expr;
00047   p->env = env;
00048   p->value = NULL;
00049   p->set = 0;
00050   p->mutex = create_finalized_mutex();
00051 
00052   return (dfsch_object_t*)p;
00053 }
00054 
00055 /*
00056  * What are correct semantics of this function in multithreaded program is 
00057  * somehow ill-defined. With this implementation only one value will be ever 
00058  * returned, but underlying function could be called multiple times (which is 
00059  * simple extension of original single threaded R5RS semantics).
00060  */
00061 
00062 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_force_promise(dfsch_object_t* promise){
00063   dfsch_object_t* val;
00064   promise_t* p = (promise_t*)promise;
00065   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(promise) != &promise_type)
00066     dfsch_error("exception:not-a-promise", promise);
00067 
00068   if (!p->set){
00069     val = dfsch_eval_proc(p->expr, p->env);
00070     pthread_mutex_lock(p->mutex);
00071     if (!p->set){
00072       p->set = 1;
00073       p->value = val;
00074     }
00075     pthread_mutex_unlock(p->mutex);
00076   }
00077 
00078   return p->value;
00079 
00080 }
00081 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_stream_cdr(dfsch_object_t* stream){
00082   return dfsch_force_promise(dfsch_cdr(stream));
00083 }
00084 
00086 //
00087 // Scheme binding
00088 //
00090 
00091 DFSCH_DEFINE_FORM_IMPL(delay, "Create new promise"){
00092   return dfsch_make_promise(args, env);
00093 }
00094 
00095 static dfsch_object_t* native_force(void* baton, dfsch_object_t* args,
00096                                     dfsch_tail_escape_t* esc){
00097   dfsch_object_t* promise;
00098   DFSCH_OBJECT_ARG(args, promise);
00099   DFSCH_ARG_END(args);  
00100 
00101   return dfsch_force_promise(promise);
00102 }
00103 
00104 DFSCH_DEFINE_FORM_IMPL(stream_cons, NULL){
00105   dfsch_object_t* head;
00106   dfsch_object_t* tail;
00107 
00108   DFSCH_OBJECT_ARG(args, head);
00109   DFSCH_OBJECT_ARG(args, tail);
00110   DFSCH_ARG_END(args);  
00111 
00112   return dfsch_cons(dfsch_eval(head, env), 
00113                     dfsch_make_promise(dfsch_list(1,
00114                                                   tail),
00115                                        env));
00116 }
00117 
00118 static dfsch_object_t* native_stream_car(void* baton, dfsch_object_t* args,
00119                                          dfsch_tail_escape_t* esc){
00120   dfsch_object_t* stream;
00121   DFSCH_OBJECT_ARG(args, stream);
00122   DFSCH_ARG_END(args);  
00123 
00124   return dfsch_car(stream);
00125 }
00126 static dfsch_object_t* native_stream_cdr(void* baton, dfsch_object_t* args,
00127                                          dfsch_tail_escape_t* esc){
00128   dfsch_object_t* stream;
00129   DFSCH_OBJECT_ARG(args, stream);
00130   DFSCH_ARG_END(args);  
00131 
00132   return dfsch_stream_cdr(stream);
00133 }
00134 
00135 dfsch_object_t* dfsch__promise_native_register(dfsch_object_t *ctx){
00136   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "<promise>", &promise_type);
00137   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "delay", DFSCH_FORM_REF(delay));
00138   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "force", 
00139                    dfsch_make_primitive(&native_force,NULL));
00140 
00141   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "stream-cons", DFSCH_FORM_REF(stream_cons));
00142   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "stream-car", 
00143                    dfsch_make_primitive(&native_stream_car,NULL));
00144   dfsch_define_cstr(ctx, "stream-cdr", 
00145                    dfsch_make_primitive(&native_stream_cdr,NULL));
00146 
00147 }
